title: DS6013 Spring 2023
text:
Welcome to the information site for DS 6013, Spring 2023. Here you will find updated information regarding the your capstone, including information about the presentation event and other things, including: * The format of your final documents * The format and requirements for your in-person presentation
Information about the end-of-year presentation event can be found here: Capstone Day Information.

title: Capstone Presentation Day
text:
Welcome to the information page for the presentation event for DS 6103, Spring 2023. Here you will find all information pertaining to the event, including answer to any questions you may have asked by email (to rca2t@virginia.edu).

Students’ To Do

Invite sponsors



Basic Info



Location
The Graduate, Piedmont Ballroom


Start time
8:30 AM (See schedule below)


Parking
Valet parking will be provided for sponsors


Fees
There are no fees for the event





Schedule







Time
Activitiy




8:30am
Doors open


9:00am
Opening Remarks (Phil starts and then Raf) 


9:20am
Behavioral Pattern Detection of Illegal Fishing Vessels


9:32am
Ecommerce Brands


9:44am
Real Property Record Linkage


9:56am
CRCL


10:08am
RNA fusions (chimeric RNAs)


10:20am
Predicting surgical outcomes from digitized hand-written operative records


10:32am
BREAK 


10:45am
Chronic disease, opioid use, and lifestyle choices


10:57am
Using Open-Sourced Models and Data to Study Gastrointestinal Histology Slides


11:09am
Extraction and normalization of inclusion and exclusion criteria from clinicaltrials.gov


11:21am
Equity in COVID-19 Patient Care: An Investigation Leveraging the National COVID Cohort Collaborative (N3C)


11:33am
Tracking COVID Impacts on Albemarle County Student Mental Health Over Time


11:45am
Considering a potential relationship between the opioid crisis and domestic violent extremism (DVE)


12:00pm
LUNCH


1:15pm
Understanding Deep Learning with ML Commons benchmarking


1:27pm
Novel Applications for Large Language Models with Scraped Data


1:39pm
Putting History On The Map


1:51pm
Tracking Course and Curriculum Progressions at the University of Virginia


2:05
BREAK 


2:15pm
Will they stay or will they go? Using AI to predict turnover and increase retention


2:27pm
Engagement Time Machine


2:39pm
Identifying and Displaying EdTech Implementation Context Profiles


2:51pm
The Drivers and Impacts of Pretrial Detention in Virginia: Analysis of the Virginia Pretrial Data


3:03pm
Exploring Accountability: Text and Network Analysis of Federal Program Audits (US citizens only)


3:15pm
Break (panelists decide on awards) 


4:00pm
Closing remarks and Awards
